intro: Popowia foetida, commonly known as the stinking popowia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its strong, unpleasant odor, it is sometimes referred to as the "smelly" popowia.
